channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The World Economy Awaits Trump’s First Round of Tariffs
item.description: Economists, policymakers and investors are bracing for a trade war that has been brewing since Election Day.

item.title: Hamas Names 3 Hostages It Says Will Be Freed This Weekend
item.description: Keith Siegel, an American-Israeli, will be released along with Yarden Bibas and Ofer Kalderon in exchange for about 90 Palestinians being held in Isra...

item.title: New pain drug, Vertex’s Journavx, gets FDA approval as safer alternative to addictive opioids
item.description: Each year, about 125 million opioid prescriptions are written for Americans with pain caused by broken bones, burns, surgeries, and other injuries and...

item.title: ‘Bond King’ Bill Gross bought a ‘BONDS 1’ license plate to impress his boss—but dumped it when people kept asking him to bail people out of jail
item.description: Gross said the private plate debacle taught him one of the most important lessons of his career.

item.title: Norway Seizes Russian-Crewed Ship Suspected of Cutting an Undersea Cable
item.description: The authorities said they believed the vessel may have been involved in damaging the cable, the latest act of apparent sabotage in the Baltic Sea.

item.title: Trump Tariffs Could Hurt Oil Companies and Increase Gas Prices
item.description: Some oil refineries will probably struggle to replace imported crude oil if President Trump imposes 25 percent tariffs on products from Canada and Mex...

item.title: Joni Mitchell, Billie Eilish and More Sing Love Letter to L.A. at FireAid
item.description: Katy Perry belted out “California Gurls,” and Joni Mitchell offered a rare performance as Angelenos spoke movingly about loss — and resilience.

item.title: JPMorgan’s internal tool shows many offices aren’t ready for the unpopular return to office mandate
item.description: JPMorgan Chase’s Polaris location not yet available for returning workers

item.title: How the World Is Reeling From Trump’s Aid Freeze

item.title: JetBlue’s $499 gamble: A new travel credit card that promises mile-high perks for a sky-high price
item.description: Here’s everything you need to know about the JetBlue Premier World Elite Mastercard premium travel credit card.

item.title: Gaza’s Border Crossing at Rafah Reopens to Let Sick and Wounded Leave
item.description: The Rafah crossing has been shuttered for over eight months.

item.title: Trump’s Deportations Only Work if Countries Agree to Take Their Citizens Back
item.description: Sending people to another country requires bilateral negotiations and diplomatic strong arming.

item.description: The Rafah crossing has been shuttered for over eight months.

item.title: How EA’s $5 billion Sims empire has become a magnet for female talent in a male-dominated field
item.description: As The Sims turns 25, the women-led team reflects on how they helped build one of the best-selling games of all time.

item.title: A Conflict in Congo
item.description: Critical minerals factor into the fight.
